captions.text:
[ Don ]
Okay, let me out.

Hey, Slater,
you fuckin' hippie,
gimme drugs, man!

- [ Slater] Get some from your mother, man.
- Wejust bagged your mother.

Fuckyou,
dick-head.

Those guys, man.
[ Chuckles ]

What's goin' on?
l haven't seen you
in so long.

Man, what is happenin'?
Long time... no see.

What have you been up to?
Same old shit, man.

Workin' for the city.
Workin' man, huh?

Been thinkin' about
gettin' back in school, man.

Back inJ.C.,
somethin' like that?

That's where all
the girls are, right?

On the other hand,
l'djust as soon
keep workin',

keep a little change
in my pocket.

Rather than listen
to some dipshit...

who doesn't know what
the hell he's talking about.

You're a freshman,
right?

So tell me, man.
How's this year's crop
offreshman chicks lookin'?

Wood, you're gonna end up
injail sometime really soon.

No, man.
No, let me tell you.

That's what
l love about these
high school girls, man.

l get older,
they stay the same age.

[ Laughing ]
Yes, they do.

title: High School Girls - Dazed and Confused (9/12) Movie CLIP (1993) HD

comments.author: ahceda09

comments.text:
This whole sequence was filmed at an old strip mall on the corner of Lamar 
Blvd and Brentwood Avenue.  It's four blocks from my house.  I like Matthew 
McConaughhey because more than most people will ever know he absolutely 
NAILED this character.  There were hundreds of guys exactly like this in 
mid 70's Austin.  It never occurred to me at the time that they were a 
"type" because they were just regular guys to me.  It was this movie that 
made me realize they had a style and were unique.  I kinda miss 'em a 
little.  They all have child support payments, ugly feet and young chubby 
girlfriends now.  ﻿
comments.author: NelsonClick

comments.text:
+ContrarianCorner The hazing was probably just a regional thing. One of my 
old bosses explained to me once that the hazing in this movie was 
a tradition in that part of Texas. The thing that amazes me was that around 
the time this was being filmed, McConaughey's dad passed away and he still 
was able to pull himself together and give this great performance.
comments.author: Jay Jay

comments.text:
He truly did NAIL this character.  We had our own "Wooderson" hanging out 
around my school in Southern California too.  I'm the same age as the 
"freshman" in this movie - finished 8th grade in '76.  When I first saw it 
in the theater in '93, I couldn't stop laughing my a$$ off!  We didn't 
experience the hazing portrayed in the film but just about everything else 
was 100% accurate with my experience at that time. 

Ohh, the memories... if I could only remember them.
comments.author: ContrarianCorner

comments.author: Jordan Max

comments.text:

as if you may have troubles on the home front, but I'll forget that. And 
yeah I'm a Junior so... Point being he never said dating a 14 year old, 
jesus christ, "how is the crop" is what he said. When crops are ready to be 
harvested they are harvested, not at an early point. I recon you learn 
analogies first. So technically, once a girl get into her junior year, it 
is okay as long as the guy is 23 or under. I've already gone way to far

that says it's okay for a 23 year old guy to be dating a 14 year old girl. 
Get your facts straight.
